file_content.text: I see you've disposed of your escort.
You the one who sent that summons?
Did you call me here?
You are here because I have use for you. Do not forget that.
Can't say I appreciate Sith hospitality.
Didn't care for their welcome.
Start. Destroy what is mine again and I shall return the favor.
You enjoy stating the obvious?
Choose your words as if your life depends on them pleasing me.
Ow! Owie! Boss protect Blizz from droid-man, right?
You know, think I'm just gonna wait out in the hall....
Gonna remember that.
Let's play nice with this one, please....
Today, Corellia's leadership swore allegiance to the Sith Empire. Despite total occupation, the people openly rebel.
What should have been a bloodless victory has escalated into full-scale war. The Treaty of Coruscant is no more.
I want the Supreme Chancellor's head in my hand when I deliver victory to the Dark Council. You will provide it.
That doesn't sound like an offer.
And my fee?
You will be adequately compensated.
What makes you think I'm gonna work for you?
You've got a lot of nerve.
Refusal would be unwise.
Don't ask much, do you?
That's a tall order.
I ask what I require.
If wealth and acclaim are not enough incentive, perhaps revenge will motivate you.
You have made an enemy in the Supreme Chancellor's closest advisor. Do what I ask and you will have your opportunity for vengeance.
I'll assist you as long as you make it worth my while.
I'm here for the money.
Fine, but I'm watching you.
The sooner I get to break that Jedi's face, the better.
Great, I'm dying to kill him.
So long as our enemies remain on Coruscant they are beyond even your reach, but Jun Seros will not be difficult to draw out.
Getting to him will put you within striking distance of the Supreme Chancellor. Corellia is where we will put them down.
There are obstacles that must be removed before we can act. You will remove them.
Person, place or thing?
What kind of obstacles?
For a price, of course.
Long as I'm getting paid to.
Of course.
I'm afraid I don't deal with "obstacles."
Be more specific.
Some old enemies from the last war have re-emerged.
A Republic privateer made famous assisting Hylo Visz break the Mandalorian's blockade.
And a Kuati noblewoman credited with orchestrating numerous successful uprisings on Imperial-occupied worlds.
Consider them dealt with.
I'll take care of them.
You want them back, or gone?
Dead or alive?
They could prove useful, but leave nothing to chance if there is any risk of their escape.
What makes these two worth taking out of the picture?
Seems like a waste of time.
The Kuati woman is in a position to turn an entire species in tune with the Force against us.
And the privateer could rally thousands of independent ships to his aid. Allowing either to assist the Corellians would be fatal.
This star chart shows the last destination of your first target. Make it his final. My subordinates will brief you upon arrival.
Mako, the situation's taken care of. Unlock the hangar; I'll explain when I get back.
Really? That's it? Okay, see you soon.
Torian, you can stand down. I'll brief you when I get back.
I'll stand down when I see you, if it's the same to you.
Lieutenant. We are finished.
My lord! Come along, bounty hunter.
You are free to go.
What should have been a bloodless victory, is now the fulcrum of this war.
You won't get away with this....
Quite a pile we stacked up.
So, do we make a run for it?
I came here to speak with the Sith. That's what I'm going to do.
We pay a visit to their boss.
I don't have a better suggestion. Let's do it.
Doubt we'd make the jump to hyperspace. We're flying out of here on this bird.
Not in our ship.
You want to steal an Imperial capital ship? Oh man, that'd have them red in the face.
I'm sending this ship down in flames.
Run? We destroy them.
I know better than to argue....
Mako, lock out access to this hangar and be ready for further instructions.
No sweat.
We're all counting on you.
Be careful, you two.
Torian, secure the hangar and be ready for further instructions.
Understood.
K'oyacyi!
You better have a good reason for this.
My presence was requested.
I've been ordered to bring you before my lord, Darth Tormen.
Submit to search and seizure and come quietly.
You trying to take me prisoner, Lieutenant?
Am I under arrest?
If you attempt to resist, yes.
I don't really care for that plan.
How about "no"?
You think taking my blaster's going to make a difference?
It won't help.
Wha--spare me your insolence.
Alien filth has no right to question Imperial protocol. You will not be allowed before a Lord of the Sith armed.
You are under jurisdiction of this Imperial vessel, and I will not permit you to remain armed in the presence of a Lord of the Sith.
You will comply. Willingly or by force.
I'm not gonna be at your mercy.
I don't trust you.
Seize them.
Anyone still around by the time the lieutenant here hits the ground, joins him.
Wanna live? Run.
Seize this scum.
Cowards! You'll all be court-martialed!
What are you waiting for?
There's no need for this to get messy.
Very well, I'll come along.
Private, disable the bounty hunter's weaponry.
Sir, the guest is fit for presentation.
Very good, Private. You, come along. Detain the rest of them.
My lord, the bounty hunter has arrived.
You are dismissed, Lieutenant.
My lord.
Easy buddy.
